properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 3:54PM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...A Flood Warning continues for portions of the following waterways
in Indiana...

Big Blue River...Buck Creek...Driftwood River...Eagle Creek...East
Fork White River...Eel River...Flatrock River...Mill Creek...
Mississinewa River...Sugar Creek...Tippecanoe River...Wabash
River...White River...Wildcat Creek...Youngs Creek...

.With rainfall totals between 1 to 2 inches there are
widespread flooding concerns across much of Indiana. Over the next
couple of days we will see another 1 to 3 inches of rain or more
possible.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Mill Creek near Cataract.
* until further notice.
* At  3:30 PM Friday the stage was 12.4 feet.
* Flood stage is 15.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by this afternoon and continue to
rise to near 16.1 feet by this evening.
* At 16.5 feet...Flood water near or on Owen Park Road.  Camp Otto
Road flooded by several feet of water.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.
